file_content.text: Hey, Sith! Leaving us for good, eh? Got what you came for I take it?
That's none of your business.
Don't bother me.
Pretend I never asked.
The Sith are the heart of the Empire, I always say.
My thanks.
Who are you again?
Do I know you?
What? The major and I--
Calm down, Captain. The Sith is just having a little fun with us, isn't that right?
I don't know what you're talking about.
No.
Major Bessiker! Sorry, you soldiers all look the same.
Oh! I remember!
Ha. You must have a lot on your mind, Sith. The captain and I were the ones who helped you into that pit.
As far as you're concerned, I was never here. Got it?
You don't know me.
I see. You need your plans to be kept secret. If anyone asks, I say, "Sith who?"
Anyway, we wanted to see you off--give you a good pat on the back and a little parting gift.
You're too kind, really.
You shouldn't have.
Thank you.
Leave me alone.
All right. We don't want to interfere with your plans.
Safe travels, Sith. It was a pleasure working for you--and thanks again for saving my son.
I don't know what you need in that toxic pit, but you have your serum. Good luck.
Doctor Tyrek is just over there. He'll fix you up with your serum.
Hey, if it isn't the hero of the hour. I just heard from my son--I knew you wouldn't fail me.
I was hoping he'd come back to base so we could catch up, but he said he was busy. Do you think he's okay?
He will do what he wants, and he can handle himself.
He's Sith.
Ah, I see. Important Sith business, eh? Well, the Sith are the heart of the Empire.
I think he hates your guts.
He doesn't like you much.
Heh. That's your, uh, winning sense of humor again, isn't it? Why should my boy hate me?
I sacrificed a great deal to see that he got trained on Korriban. Oh well, we'll chat later.
He's just enjoying his independence.
He's fine.
Boys will be boys, eh? You're probably right. He just needs some space.
But you're not interested in any of this family stuff, I bet. You're here for your serum.
Is it ready for me to use?
That's right.
Sure is. But I think Doctor Tyrek here wants to have a word with you, first.
You've been a great help--the least I can do is listen.
I don't mind.
No, you've been enough help already, my lord.
We had a deal.
You upheld your end of our little bargain; I'll uphold mine.
Doctor Tyrek will fix you up with the serum and explain what we know about it.
Stay back, Sith. I said stay back and don't lay a hand on me!
I know what you did. We had an agent in that outpost, and he reported everything!
I told you you wouldn't get your serum if you didn't help--and you killed him!
You don't know who you're dealing with.
You fool.
Sorry.
Don't make me kill you, too.
Careful, Major.
You're nothing but a cold-blooded murderer! You enjoyed killing him, didn't you? Didn't you?
Don't do this to yourself.
You don't want to know.
To be honest, I've had better.
Maybe.
I knew it! You're sick! Sick!
I didn't enjoy it.
What was necessary? For what?
Please just tell me one thing--why? Why did you have to kill him?
We have holo-images of the cell. The controls were right there. You could have freed him. You would have gotten your serum. Why?
He had the holocron, I wanted the holocron.
For power.
He would have done the same to me.
It's the Sith way.
No he wouldn't have!
I wanted to see what kind of pattern his blood would make.
Idle fun.
He didn't deserve this.
He was a good boy! And I trusted you with his life!
Your son was a disciple of the dark side--he knew what that meant, and he certainly wasn't a good boy.
He was Sith!
It doesn't matter now. He's dead.
Believe what you like.
I grow tired of you.
Yawn.
You evil, wretched, bloodthirsty... I'll kill you! I'll kill you! You'll never get your serum because I'll kill you!
Please, save my son!
It's my son. He arrived shortly after you left for the research facility, but then he went after some... "holocron," he called it.
A few minutes ago I got what I think was a distress call from him. He's in trouble!
He can handle himself.
He's Sith.
Do you know where he is?
Point the way.
No.
Look, I didn't want to have to do this, but it sounds like I have no choice.
This is my son we are talking about, and if you want your serum, you'll save him.
Have you forgotten who you're dealing with?
You're out of line, Major.
If you put it that way.
Oh, all right.
Don't twist my arm.
I have pull in important circles, and my brother is a high-ranking Sith. You'll listen if you know what's good for you.
All this time you've been running around, we've been fighting a war.
I've been more than happy to help, but not at the expense of my son's life!
Nobody gives me orders.
Watch it.
Then you won't get your serum.
It's your grave, Major.
You'll pay.
Save your idle threats. You won't get your serum without me.
Fine.
I'm sorry it had to come to this. I like you, I really do.
We narrowed the origin of the distress call to an abandoned building near the Republic crater outpost.
I'm guessing the Republic's captured him, which means a lot of fighting to free him. Good luck.
Sith-- I'm sorry to interrupt you. I'm sure you're very busy. Congratulations, by the way--I heard that you found our scientist.
We'll whip up that serum and get you into that toxic waste pit in no time. But there's a problem, and I need your help.
Just have the serum ready for me.
There's only one thing I want.
You'll get your serum... but you need to help me.
I'd be happy to help any way I can.
What can I do?
Forget it.
Look, you know I hold you in the highest respect, so I wouldn't ask if it wasn't truly important.
You'll need to steal back our scientist from the Republic if you want to recreate the Colicoids' toxic waste resistance.
Our chief scientist defected to the Republic a few months back. We can't begin to replicate, let alone test, the serum without him.
I guess we need to un-defect him.
He's coming back then.
Un-defect indeed. You certainly have a way with words, Sith.
Have there been a lot of defections?
Defections?
Lately, yes.
Of course, the defectors' bodies usually turn up a few weeks later in a ditch somewhere.
How do we know this scientist is still alive?
That's not promising.
I guess you could say we lucked out in this case. Seems like our chief scientist was very good at getting away.
Any idea how they end up that way?
Who kills them?
That's... classified.
Like so many people I've known.
Wonderful, isn't it?
We have intelligence that Iannos Tyrek, our chief scientist, is alive and on Balmorra--in a Republic research base out near the toxic lakes.
This scientist is the only one who can do this?
There's no one else?
I'm afraid so. Command on Dromund Kaas just isn't making Balmorra that high a priority these days.
The scientist's name is Iannos Tyrek, and he's still on Balmorra--in a Republic research base out near the toxic lakes.
All right, Sith. It looks like you have your next objective.
You find this scientist; you subdue him. My men will bring him back, and we'll get you your chance to swim in toxic waste.
I'm on it.
Why me?
Those bases are heavily guarded. I don't have enough men for a full strike force, and that's what it'd take for non-Sith.
The Republic's going to taste blood tonight.
This will be fun.
Oh, and Sith--hurry back. I just got word that my son passed his trials on Korriban and is on his way to Balmorra.
I don't want you to miss him.
Major, if we don't get those supply vehicles...!
My men are working on it, sir, but until that shipment of plasteel I requested three months ago comes in--
I don't care! Tear it off the walls if you have to!
What was that all about?
Care to explain?
It's not wise to keep a Sith waiting!
Ahem.
What's the problem?
Don't worry about the colonel. He's loud and impatient, but we all are these days, what with the supply shortage.
Now, did you manage to find anything out at the lab? Captain Ilun and I have been doing our own research, but we haven't discovered much.
A lot of data there, not sure how useful.
I don't know.
There were bugs, bugs and more bugs.
As expected.
I hope the Colicoids didn't give you too much trouble.
Let's just say I wouldn't want to live there.
Disgusting.
Have a look at this, Captain. I can't make head or tail of it.
Hmm. This confirms our suspicions. The Colicoids were being mutated to clean up the waste, and it looks like the chemical mutagen they were using could theoretically work....
Well that's it! That's our solution, right? We just replicate this chemical mutagen!
Um, sir, there's a problem....
The sooner you get to the lab and find out what the Balmorrans did to those Colicoids, the sooner we can get you into that hazard vault.
There must be a way for you to take on the Colicoids' resistance, so you can enter that vault. Captain--where were these creatures created?
Well... I can't say for sure, but... there's a research lab not far from here that was overrun with Colicoids as soon as the Balmorrans abandoned it.
But the Colicoids are vicious creatures--just one of them tore apart a whole squad.
I think I can handle a few bugs.
Don't worry about me.
If you can get into that lab and find out the Colicoids' secret, we'll do what we can to get you into that toxic pit.
I can't afford to make excuses--I need the information in that lab.
I need to get in there.
You call yourself an army?
You're pathetic.
I'm sorry, Sith--we don't have the numbers to deal with these things. But if you can get into that lab, we'll get you into that toxic pit.
Sir, even if we find out what causes this resistance, we don't have--
We'll worry about that later. Right now, our Sith friend has to get into that lab and find out what the Balmorrans did to those creatures.
There's something of great value in one of the hazard vaults... the one that was blown open. I heard you could help.
You can help me find an item.
Ah, who's this... Sith? And an alien at that! It's a real pleasure. I have a son on Korriban, you know.
Ah, who's this... Sith! We don't often get Sith on Balmorra. It's a real pleasure. I have a son on Korriban you know.
It's a tough war you're walking into--we're fixing blasters with adhesive tape--but we'll help you any way we can.
Now let's see... a blown open vault, hmm? Captain, do we still have those pumps-- ?
Sir, if this is the vault I think it is-- it won't be that easy. The fumes alone have put men in the medical center.
Do we have anything else we can work with?
What's Plan B?
I need to get to the bottom of that pit.
I don't care.
There has to be something that can withstand this stuff.
We can't give up so easily.
We need some way to make this pit less deadly. Tell me, Captain, is there nothing that can survive the toxic waste?
Well... nothing grows there, sir, but there are the Colicoids.
Colicoids! What do those bugs want with toxic waste?
Food, sir. Our surveillance satellites have recorded them feeding on the toxic waste. We suspect they've been designed to eat it.
So how do I become a Colicoid?
I need that ability.
Why would they be designed to eat waste?
Who would do such a thing?
That's ridiculous.
It does seem like a strange thing to do. Captain?
It's a guess. The toxic waste resistance may have been an unintended result--or the Balmorran scientists were insane.
How can I get that resistance?
Get me that power.
Sir!
No, Captain, she's right. To get to the bottom of that pit, she'll need to become like the Colicoids.
No, Captain, he's right. To get to the bottom of that pit, he'll need to become like the Colicoids.
I personally prefer the term "differently rational."
Insane is such a crude word.
Well whatever you call it, it might be just what we need to crack this thing.
Hurry up.
If these creatures were created by science, there has to be a way to replicate the experiment.
Sorry, I'm very busy right now and I don't have time to talk.
